intro: Sphaeralcea fulva, commonly known as yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and parts of Mexico. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are typically clustered in globular inflorescences. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert and chaparral environments. Sphaeralcea fulva is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
